medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in his usual state of health until after midnight when he woke up due to severe abdominal pain, described as band-like in the epigastrium. The pain was initially ___ in intensity, non-radiating, and eventually localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Symptoms were associated with subjective fevers, rigors, nausea, anorexia, and non-bilious vomiting three times. The patient has been unable to tolerate oral intake due to abdominal pain and took Tylenol #3 without resolution of symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma; Previous surgery: Bilateral laparoscopic inguinal hernia repair.
